sentence.Network_en: So many days are routine and uninteresting, especially in winter.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多日子都过得平淡乏味，尤其是在冬天。

sentence.Network_en: Their media has earned the reputation for being rather dull and uninteresting.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的媒体获得了相当单调、乏味的名声。

sentence.Network_en: Why did he choose these pale, nerveless, uninteresting people?
sentence.Network_cn: 他为什么选了这么些脸色苍白、有气无力而又无聊乏味的人？

unimolecular substitution 单分子取代uninteresting peak 不重要的峰；无用的峰union 管套结
Forget about boring text books and uninteresting subjects !, 忘记那些枯燥的课本和无聊的话题吧!

entry.tran: 无趣味的；引不起兴趣的
entry.def: If you describe something or someone as uninteresting, you mean they have no special or exciting qualities.

example.ex: Their media has earned the reputation for being rather dull and uninteresting...
example.tran: 他们的媒体获得了相当单调、乏味的名声。

example.ex: Why did he choose these pale, nerveless, uninteresting people?
example.tran: 他为什么选了这么些脸色苍白、有气无力而又无聊乏味的人？

means.word_mean: 1. arousing no interest or attention or curiosity or excitement;

sentences.sentence: "a very uninteresting account of her trip"

means.word_mean: 2. characteristic or suggestive of an institution especially in being uniform or dull or unimaginative;
